intro: Baliospermum angulare, commonly known as the angular morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbers. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it both a popular garden plant and a potential invasive species in some areas.
